p: The Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) is a mosquito-borne reemerging arbovirus responsible for intermittent and devastating outbreaks [ 1]. The largest epidemic of CHIKV ever recorded started in Africa in 2004 and has spread globally, reaching the Americas in 2014. The disease has afflicted four continents, affected more than 100 countries and infected over 10 million people [ 2, 3]. Its global impact is still growing [ 4]. CHIKV has spread rapidly through several Brazilian states and infected a total of 20,598 individuals in 2015 [ 5]; furthermore, more than 200,000 suspected cases were reported in 2017â€“2018 [ 6].
